channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 17th January
item.description:
A regular occurrence. The flytip at the back has been there for 7 weeks and the one at the front is new . Please remove. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albatross Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside dry cleaner at 229 West End Lane, 17th January
item.description:
Very loose paving stone which is a trip hazard as it flips up and down and stands a good inch or more above the flat surface. It’s been like this for several weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sumatra Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Christmas trees on Graham Road A1207, 17th January
item.description:
Christmas trees blocking the pavement for several days now. In front of 153 Graham Road and pedestrian crossing. Please fix.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Litter in public area owned by the council, 17th January
item.description:
This is the third time I’m reporting this letter. First time I was told it was sorted when it wasn’t second time I was told this wasn’t the council responsibility. This time I am sending you an image including a workman fixing the brick wall which must’ve been arranged by the council, therefore this land is owned by the council as it is a council estate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelina Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees need trimming, 17th January
item.description:
There has been loads of residents complaining to housing officers and online about the trees on layard road se16 2je there overgrown makes the road pitch black coz the lights are blocked by the trees and CCTV can’t see anything also makes the flooor very slippery they have not been touched for years please can someone do something about this and make it a safer road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fenner Close, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: This car has been here months., 17th January
item.description:
This picture was taken last weekend, I deliver weekly to The Range Penge and makes reversing in a bit of pain some days and surprised ive not hit it. Stupid that the silver car got clamped by dvla and has now been removed this week but the Citroën AX is still remains with a flat tyre.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meaford Way, Anerley, Greater London
